title: Chocolate Cinnamon Coffee Syrup
directions: In a small saucepan, whisk together sugar, cocoa powder, and ground cinnamon.
Add water and stir well to create a smooth mixture.
Simmer on low-medium heat, stirring frequently, until everything is dissolved (about 5 minutes).
Strain through a fine-mesh sieve or cheesecloth if the cinnamon makes the syrup slightly gritty.
Remove from heat and stir in vanilla extract.
Let cool before transferring to a syrup bottle. Store in the fridge for up to 2 weeks.
notes: Ground cinnamon works but may cause slight grittiness - strain well or use a cinnamon stick instead for a smoother result. If cocoa powder doesn't fully dissolve, whisk vigorously while heating or blend after cooking. Pairs well with lattes, Mexican mochas, and hot cocoa.
